meanings.sent1: She was slowly naturalising to her new surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The children were naturalising to the idea of having a pet at home.
meanings.sent3: After a while, the idea of eating vegetables started naturalising in his mind.
meanings.sent4: The concept of recycling quickly naturalised in the community.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter naturalised the tense atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: To adopt or adapt to a new environment or culture.
meanings.sent1: The family was naturalising to the customs of their new country.
meanings.sent2: The students were naturalising to the local language in no time.
meanings.sent3: He tried naturalising to the idea of eating spicy food, but it was a struggle.
meanings.sent4: The plant was naturalising to the sunny climate of its new home.
meanings.sent5: The puppy was naturalising to its new family with wagging tail and playful barks.
